page.title: 09OLD DEAN ESTATE.
page.content: After the Second World War military affiliations of the residents of Camberley diluted.Expansion was more rapid with a London overspill estate in 1950s (light industry providing employment grew up on the other side of Camberley).Later the completion of the M3 brought more commuters and the older houses were redeveloped as cul- de-sacs and new housing estates were built. The council overspill estate known as the Old Dean immediately established a bad reputation with the traditional Camberley residents.The naming of the roads after areas where residents had previously lived(eg.Mitcham & Wimble- don Roads) did not make them all feel at home.Schools expanded rapidly and a community developed.30 years later the reputation lingers but private owners now are moving onto the estate.
